llm_guidance:
# Code Generation Guidance

Generate Python code wrapped in custom delimiters (NOT markdown code blocks):
===RAVL_CODE_START===
[Your Python code here]
===RAVL_CODE_END===

Your generated code should:

- Save results to file in: output/springboks/ (use relative path, not absolute)
- File format: JSON
- Include metadata: timestamp, record count, if data changed
- Each item should have fields: id
- Implement change detection (hash-based comparison)
- Only save if data has changed from previous run

# Your code will be verified against:
- - [ ] `./output/springboks-results.json` exists and contains game results with scores, scorers, and individual player performance analysis
- - [ ] Any new or missing Springbok games have been added to `./output/springboks-results.json`
- - [ ] If a more recent game was detected than previously recorded, a new file `./output/springbok-coach-tips-YYYY-MMM-DD.md` exists with today's date containing exactly 3 coaching suggestions for Rassie based on the most recent information
- - [ ] If no more recent game was detected than previously recorded, no new coaching tips file was created
